statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Georgetown breaks away from Texas A&M-CC 78-62
article.headline: Georgetown breaks away from Texas A&M-CC 78-62
article.linkText: Georgetown breaks away from Texas A&M-CC 78-62
article.story: WASHINGTON -- Joshua Smith scored 20 points and grabbed 12 rebounds, draining a jumper during a breakaway 8-2 run to open the second half as Georgetown put away Texas A&M-Corpus Christi 78-62 on Tuesday night. Steals and boards helped Georgetown (2-0) snap a 34-34 halftime tie. L. J. Peak drove for a layup after a D'Vauntes Smith-Rivera steal, Jabril Trawick added a putback and a layup after a second steal by Aaron Bowen and Smith added a jumper in just 2:15. The Hoyas never trailed again. Smith's double-double was his first at Georgetown. Bowen added 13 points with five of the Hoyas nine steals. Georgetown shot 50.9 percent (27 of 53) and outboarded the Islanders 39-23. Bryce Douvier led Corpus Christi (1-1) with 16 points, John Jordan added 14 and Rashawn Thomas 12. The first half was close with four ties, and the lead changed 12 times.
